items.message: Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Further rainfall is forecast tomorrow Friday 05/12/25 and over the weekend. River levels will remain high over the coming days in response to this forecast rainfall.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
River levels at the Torksey gauge will pose a flood risk at the next high tide at 20:00 this evening and tomorrow morning at 07:45. Consequently, the risk of flooding of roads and farmland remains.
Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. River levels will remain high after tomorrow mornings tide. Further rainfall is forecast this evening and over the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 05 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 05 December 2025 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, specifically this evening (04/12/2025) and Friday evening (05/12/2025). River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge are rising following rainfall earlier on Thursday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible from the evening of the 04 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible tonight, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is for further rain which could be heavy at times over the next 3 days. We expect river levels to stay high.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 11:00 05 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Blunsdon Brook, Water Eaton Brook, Marston Meysey Brook, Share Ditch, Bydemill Brook, Westrop Brook, Downington Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible from the evening of the 04 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible tonight, 04 Dec 2025, along the River Thames, especially in the Kempsford area. This is as a result of rivers responding to recent rainfall. The weather forecast is for further rain which could be heavy at times over the next 3 days. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 1100 05 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: Following last night's rain, river levels rose today, including at Sherborne Lake. While other rivers in the area have peaked and in some cases started to fall, Sherborne Lake is still gradually rising and remains above Alert level, and will likely stay high into tomorrow. Further heavy and persistent rain is forecast tomorrow, Friday 05/12/2025 and overnight into Saturday. This will keep the lake level high and will cause other local rivers to rise again, including the River Yeo, River Wriggle and River Cam. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is possible in this area, including around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Therefore the need for this Alert remains. We are closely monitoring the situation, and checking defences, bridges, debris screens and culverts. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 16:00PM on 05/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels are falling slowly but remain high and the potential for flooding continues today, 4 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 5 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
Forecast rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 04 December 2025 .at 18:00 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:30AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising again at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after overnight rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 5/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

Following high river levels this morning, and a relatively dry day since then, rivers further up the catchments have fallen below Alert level, such as the River Isle at Donyatt and at Ashford Mill. The River Parrett at Chiselborough has peaked and has just fallen below Alert level. Further downstream, the river levels are only just peaking, such as at Gaw Bridge and Kingsbury Episcopi on the Parrett, and at Hambridge on the Isle. Yet further downstream at Midelney, levels are still rising and should peak quite soon. Added to this, heavy persistent rain is forecast tomorrow, Friday 05/12/2025, into Saturday morning. Therefore, this Alert needs to stay in force as levels are still high on lower stretches of the river network, and it is a relatively short period until the next band of rain on Friday. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is still possible in this area. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care, avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water, and stay vigilant for updates. This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 05/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but steady at the Lugwardine river gauge. Flooding continues today 4 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Further rain is forecast tomorrow Friday 05/12/25 and over the weekend so river levels will stay high and the flood risk remains.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. However, a further band of rain is forecast throughout Friday and river levels are forecast to rise again. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall, flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. The Severn Ham, Tewkesbury may start to fill.

Predicted peaks:-
Mythe 3.1m to 3.7m 06/12/2025 AM.
Haw Bridge 4.2m to 4.7m 07/12/2025 PM.

Tides are increasing from Wednesday until the weekend. River levels at Sandhurst and Gloucester will be influenced by these tides. Current predictions:

Sandhurst 2.9m to 3.1m 03/12/2025 PM and 3.0m to 3.2m 04/12/2025 AM.
Gloucester 2.5m to 2.8m 03/12/2025 PM and 2.8m to 3.1m 04/12/2025 AM.

Additional rainfall is forecast Friday onwards, which may cause river levels to rise further.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 5 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels over the next two days may lead to flooding.   

Flooding is possible on Thursday 04 December and on Friday 05 December. 

River levels remain high and a further band of rain is expected on Friday.  

Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river.  

We expect the river to remain high overnight and into tomorrow, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.   

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.   

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Please remain vigilant and prepared for further flood alerts.

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.  

Flooding is possible on Friday 05 December. 

A band of rain is expected on Friday.  

Forecast river levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. 

The main areas of concern are Yealmpton, Yealmbridge and Mill Bridge. 

We expect the river to remain high overnight on Friday, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.  

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Peaks:- Cae Howel 4.4m to 4.5m on 04/12 AM. items.description: Severn estuary from Gloucester to Sharpness
items.message:
Higher than normal tides on Thursday evening and Friday morning may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible from 8:30pm on Thursday evening and 9:00am on Friday morning.   

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the Estuary from Sandhurst to Chepstow and Sharpness over the next 5 days. Some lengths of the flood embankment at Longney and The Noards may be overtopped. Rodley Lane, Westbury and Awre Road, Brims Pill may be flooded. 

Predicted peaks: 

Thursday evening 04/12; Gloucester 3.1m to 3.4m at 8:30PM, Sandhurst 3.2m to 3.5m at 9:00pm. 
Friday morning 05/12; Gloucester 3.2m to 3.5m at 9:00AM, Sandhurst 3.4m to 3.7m at 9:15pm. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides, strong winds and large waves tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 02:00AM to 04:30AM on Friday 05 December 2025. 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths, particularly in the Beadnell Harbour Road North area. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast high river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 04 December 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Churnet between Leek and Rocester and the River Tean between Adderley and Spath including Cecilly Brook at Cheadle. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Rainfall on Thursday and Friday night into Saturday day will keep levels on the River Dee high. Levels will remain high over the weekend and into early next week. We are not expecting to reach Flood Warning levels. Access to Townfield could be impacted from late Saturday afternoon.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Dee. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 16:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. River levels at Willington Gauge and Shardlow Gauge will rise overnight into tomorrow morning 05/12/2025, and remain high for the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 05 December 2025, or as the situation changes.
